website_summaries.verdict: Stylish, spacious fire pit that will handle larger hardwood campfires. Moon and star cutouts provide good ventilation as well as aesthetics. Reasonably priced and performs well.
pros: Deeper-than-average bowl allows larger fires to be built
Removable spark screen protects users and property
cons: Existing drain hole may need modifications or additions
Heat-resistant paint, but not rust-resistant steel
Bottom of fire bowl can overheat without the addition of sand

website_summaries.verdict: Add a touch of artistic flair to your patio or porch with this generously sized fire pit.
pros: Spark screen, built-in grate strips, and firewood poker/lifting tool
Finished with rustic patina-colored high-temperature paint
Mesh-lined cutouts keep embers from escaping
cons: Prone to rust, so be sure to get a cover to keep water out
Consider drilling drainage holes in the bottom

customer_reviews.title: Good fire pit, a few flaws.
customer_reviews.text: The fire pit is very attractive and mostly as described. The only problems I see are that the metal is thinner than I expected and after a couple of nights in the rain rust was already developing. There is no way for the water to drain out if it gets rained on so I drilled a few holes in the bottom. I consider this a design flaw, as the pit can hardly be moved indoors when it is hot. As I live in the Pacific Northwest, everything gets rained on. Despite this, I do like it and am happy to have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this fire pit and it is great for the price! My old fire pit wore out and I replaced it with this. Love the side cutouts. I added an internal grill on spacers and I recommend that for better burn.
customer_reviews.author: Therese A.

customer_reviews.title: Not functional
customer_reviews.text: This piece looks great but after using it for the summer, it is getting quite rusty. It apparently has no rust coating at all and for something you use outside, that is totally unacceptable. In the spring we will need to give it a coating of Rustoleum if we want it to be useable for a few years at least. Would not buy this again. Looks great but zero functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Easy rider

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful large fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Got this as part of our backyard renovation project. Shipping was super fast, received it earlier than expected. Large fire pit, super easy to assemble, it’s a Sturdy piece! I read the reviews and decided to take some precautions - we drilled 3 drain holes at the base- fast and easy to do. We also bought a cover just in case. Used it the same day during a chilly NC night to watch an outdoor movie with friends and blankets in the back yard. Worked amazingly and kept us toasty. Love the cutouts! Friends asked where we got it all night. Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: The bar around the edge is cool and sturdy enough to put your feet up on ...
customer_reviews.text: Thick steel bottom we were looking for. It has a screen that is a requirement in our neighborhood and a stick for lifting it for convenience. We always get compliments on the glowing moon and stars around the edges too. The bar around the edge is cool and sturdy enough to put your feet up on it. There is enough space underneath to put your feet on a cooler night for more heat.
customer_reviews.author: The Guy

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL FIRE PIT!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the product! It is a well made fire pit that is attractive to the eye and does the job well. It was simple to assemble and just fits an outdoor space beautifully with its clean simple lines. It’s well worth the money. Unfortunately ours had a hole or a tear in it and it was not noticed until we actually used the pit. (See pic ). The sellers stood behind the product and allowed us to return it and get a refund. I would definitely do business with this seller again and recommend them to others. They were stellar!!
customer_reviews.author: carolynneb

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and sturdy for this price point. I have burned almost every weekend for over a year and it has held up. Some days I keep a fire going for 8 plus hours. It lost it's new look after the first few rains (even with a cover), but that doesn’t bother me. The cutouts on the side look really cool at night. Only thing that will need replacing soon is the screen cover. It still works, but there are some small holes that are starting to appear. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Crumbled - Not as high quality as they used to make it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 42 inch firepit again for the second time in February 2018 and it crumbled with very little use. The first one that I bought in 2015 lasted for three years with regular and almost daily use. I was very pleased with that one and that was the reason I decided to buy again for the second time. The lid usually crumbles earlier than the bottom, in a year or two. They do not sell only the lid. Not sure if it is poor quality material... assumption based on the price the first time price was much higher and perhaps higher quality metal was used. My own experience, not trying to influence anyone else, just disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with damages, looks flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: It's not easy to assembly as the whole design is rickety. The main pit itself is not very strong (they do say 0.7mm so I cannot complain). However, damaged product when I unbox really irritated me. As you can see from the picture it arrived in this condition. Once unboxed it's a pain to put it back and I guess the vendor relies on this for fewer returns. I am not going to return this but I am unhappy. Will update after use but as of now only 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: rnandu

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after six months
customer_reviews.text: Note: We bought the full cover for this unit, so unit has been completely covered 100% of the time when not in use. After MAYBE 5 fires in a six month period, we uncovered it this spring to find it all rusted. Completely unattractive - looks like an eyesore on the patio. For $189 PLUS money for the cover suggested, it should be aesthetically pleasing longer than 6 months. If you are good with a rust covered unit, this is for you. If you want something that looks nice, go with another unit.
customer_reviews.author: Diane from Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Seems Solid but I Do Not Like the Paint Job.
customer_reviews.text: The paint on it makes it look like it's going to start rusting right off the bat. I bought this for a Christmas present so I had time to give it a few coats of high heat paint. I also painted the ring silver that way there would be a definite line to see around the pit. It comes with a pointed lift in the bottom but I plan on using a slightly higher raised rack for the wood. Other than that it seems fine and easy to assemble. I would recommend a cover whether you add extra paint or not.
customer_reviews.author: RayTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice, well-made fire pit but...
customer_reviews.text: There are no drain holes so the pit collects rain water if left uncovered. Ash must be scooped out of the bottom, and cleaning requires turning the whole unit over carefully since the three legs are not exceedingly sturdy. the top grill is well-constructed but requires a strong poker to remove as it gets very hot and cannot be removed by hand to stoke the fire or adjust logs.
customer_reviews.author: PitkinGirl

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the fire pit and find it to be large enough to hold even the biggest of logs. It’s easy to move around because of the ring that goes all the way around it. However, I have stored this fire pit for the winter on my covered patio and apun pulling it out last week I noticed there is a large amount of rust on the outside body of the fire pit. I do live on the water but this fire pit was not exposed to any direct weather elements. I’m not too sure why it rusted already. It is still fully functional though And I do intend on purchasing another one for our rental cottages.
customer_reviews.author: Real opinion

customer_reviews.title: Not sufficiently rust resistant
customer_reviews.text: I purchases this fire pit because the product description included claims that it was rust resistant. After only one month outside this spring the fire pit and the mesh top began to rust. It is very unattractive and I didn't intend to learn how to de-rust and seal a $200 fire pit. The Sunnydaze Cosmic Outdoor Fire Pit - 42 Inch Large Bonfire Wood Burning Patio & Backyard Firep is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: junky, don't be fooled......don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a fire pit that looked exactly like this a few years ago. It was excellent.....high quality, heavy, well built etc.....and this one looked exactly like the one I bought previously. IT WAS NOT. This thing is a flimsy piece of junk. The meal is so thin, you can push on it with your hand and it will bend. The rail around the top is delicate/flimsy as well. My guess is it will burn or rust through in a very short time. Keep shopping, this one is garbage. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Skagway

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: Very large! Used at a party and people seemed to be very impressed by it. The bottom is a little flimsy but it has reinforcement bars tack welded on to give it more support. Really haven't had it long to comment on durability but I do feel it is best not to leave out in the weather all the time. I dump the ashes out and place it under a shed when not in use. I believe it wouldn't take long to rust out if I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for One to Two Seasons
customer_reviews.text: Other write-ups were true; one to two seasons before this thing goes to the scrap yard. But again, you get what you pay for. I assume if you pay $500+ you'll get heavier, and generally better quality - well, with anything - right. Do like the large size, fire light through the star/moon holes, and additional optional cover - which keeps the ash from blowing around the next day. Probably would buy another one...
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire Pit
customer_reviews.text: The fire pit was large and worked perfectly. We had an amazing fire that kept all of my guests toasty warm.
customer_reviews.author: Brigid Lau

customer_reviews.title: Nice large size but thin metal
customer_reviews.text: I love the size, after putting it together it is not real thick material. After reading reviews I repainted with heat paint for extra protection and also added more holes in the bottom to make sure if it rains it will drain all the water. Also added a log holder that I put in the bottom so wood would burn above the bottom. Hope it last for years only time will yell.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great customer support equals excellent business model.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to replace my existing fire pit that rusted-out. This served great, for about a week, until the protective ring disconnected. I contacted their customer support, they refunded me in full. Good product, great customer support equals excellent business model. 5/5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to this fire pit!

I've attached a picture of the lengthy dent in the bottom of the pit. Assembly was simple, once we found directions on YouTube. The picture instructions that were included were not clear. It's been so warm that we haven't burned anything yet, but we're definitely looking forward to it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily M.

customer_reviews.title: This is very light weight
customer_reviews.text: I feel this is very light weight. Too light weight to hold up. I love the size and if it hold up a season I will be surprised. 2 seasons I will be amazed. Looks great just too early to tell
customer_reviews.author: RTR Barry

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my husband as an early birthday ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as an early birthday present and he absolutely loves it, already had a fire in it the other night. His only complaint or maybe he was just curious why no drain holes were in the bottom in case of rain and no cover had not been put on. Would just make it hard to dump the water each time this should happen. Anyways just a thought for the dream/engineering team !!!!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed

When we removed from the box there was a large dent on one side and several scratches along the bottom. Unfortunately people were coming to the party and it had to be used that evening. I used a hammer and attempted to bend it back into shape bit for this price I shouldn’t have to do this.
customer_reviews.author: R T A

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with their customer service.

customer_reviews.title: Love This Fire Pit

One thing I would recommend is to drill some drain holes in the bottom in case water gets in. The one hole in the middle isn't enough. I would also suggest getting a grating to keep the logs off the bottom. Just a few longevity tricks!

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as Landman brand.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is difficult for 1 person. Not nearly as sturdy as Landman brand. Thinner sheet metal than most brands is a worry. Only 4 instead of 8 screws hold the outer ring in place. I doubt this will last more than 2 to 3 years. .
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: Great big firepit!

That is only a slight downside though and Not a huge deal breaker. We use it a lot and it is big enough to have many people sitting/standing around it. It was easy enough for me to put it together as it was a Valentine’s Day present for my husband. We are happy with it.

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived on time and in good shape. Have not used it as yet

Oh well.

customer_reviews.title: Good pit but poor paint job
customer_reviews.text: Overall very good quality. I have two issues. The paint was poor with color of rust which I believe is the primer. I think it should have been black. Second problem is it has one small drain hole which is inadequate even when pit is clean. To solve the second problem I drilled several larger holes to allow proper draining. I will just live with second problem until I do my annual maintenance and painting. I would most likely buy another one in future but was disappointed in the items above
customer_reviews.author: cliff C.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!

customer_reviews.author: crazylady

customer_reviews.title: Love this!

customer_reviews.text: Great fire pit. The only thing they could have improved on was give a longer poke stick. The poke stick they give is not sized proportionately to the stove. Not a big deal but would have been nice.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire Pit-get the Ravenna Cover to go with it.
customer_reviews.text: The review I did for the cover was really for the fire pit, the cover was exceptional as well, very nicely made and durable (see Ravenna Round Fire Pit cover review)
customer_reviews.author: Don McMahan

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Glad I got it. Put it to use right away and the fire stayed inside the fire pit. A+ on that. Thought it could be look a little corny, but almost all liked the cosmic shapes. Had a softball size dent in the bottom when I unpacked it. Assume that the shipping company was the culprit. Still worked though.

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as heavy duty as I expected but it worked fine / always a plus with made in china products - all the holes lined up

customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and effective. We use sparkless immatation logs and don't get any sparks. Smores and hot dogs and conversation all take place around this cool portable fire pit.

customer_reviews.title: Wood Burning outdoor Firepit
customer_reviews.text: for the money it was pretty cheaply made... pretty flimsy, I could have found one much heavier duty for that price. Not Happy at all with it! It should have been 1/2 the price for what you get..

customer_reviews.title: Metal is too thin to last.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I first bought it. But now it's rusted out on the bottom and the leg can't hold it up anymore. Such a beautiful product ruined by subpar metal.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used it only a couple times and we are extremely pleased with the product. It seems to be of good quality, it’s nice looking, and it’s a lot of fun.

customer_reviews.title: Good But Not Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, I would expect a rain cover to be included. The legs are not quite as well made/sturdy as I hoped once it’s assembled. It’s cute and works great though !
